text: @kyo1546 Chronicles of the sword... I played that mode FAR too much. It's one of the few times I've played a game until I literally passed out. I fell asleep controller in hand and then my brother woke up and was shocked to find me sitting sound asleep in gaming position in front of the TV. I never fell asleep at a console game before or since, probably because I rarely played a game so long into the night... Character creation was that game's best feature, methinks.

text: great pick of an amazing game. soul calibur 2 is IMO the best soul game. The controls on the gamecube controller fit so comfortably well. The buttons on the gamecube controller where closer together so you can use multi button combos easier and at a much more effiecient and faster rate at using them. The A button was great for a slash like button. The load times on the GCN is much more faster than the other 2 versions. there are many more reasons, and dont 4get LINK! GCN Version > All Other 1's

Including some different, blank slate fighting styles like in 3 along with being able to make a fighter based on existing fighter's styles.
author: Blues Light

text: @SupraDarky You weren't missing much. Soul Calibur II shits on Soul Calibur IV. I'm hoping it isn't still the case with V.
author: King Kalsal

text: awesome theme.  Hope Soul Calibur 5 comes out better than 4 did...
author: LionHeartXII

text: @SupraDarky Can't blame you for skipping IV, really. The gameplay is sluggish compared to the previous ones. III is my favorite, followed very very closely by 2. There's no beating the gameplay in 2, but there's a whole lot of content in III that kept me playing for quite some time. IV just didn't compare in that regard. Nice graphics and it's nice that they added online play, (enough replayability for some people in that fact alone,) but I don't like that they sacrificed that for offline stuff.
author: Voleno

text: takes me back to the summer of 03, played this game to death
author: Fitzcannon

text:
Soul Calibur V's been announced, I'm looking forward to it since I skipped IV. This game was pretty awesome, I had the Gamecube version with Link.

I've always been a fan of Nightmare's theme, powerful theme but it still has that nice calmer part.
author: SupraDarky
